articles.title: ‘He’s not Jesus Christ’: Argentina urged to keep easing pressure on Lionel Messi
articles.description: Former soccer player Gabriel Batistuta is happy to see the responsibility being shared among the Argentinian team rather than the pressure on Lionel Messi's shoulders. articles.title: Soccer-Brazil v Argentina qualifier won't be replayed, AFA says
articles.description:
The World Cup qualifier between Argentina and Brazil suspended last year will not be replayed, the Argentine Football Association (AFA) said on Tuesday.
The AFA was ordered to pay a fine of 150,000 Swiss francs ($157,778.48), with half the amount suspended for a two-year probationary period. Brazil and Argentina have both qualified for this year's World Cup in Qatar.
articles.content: The World Cup qualifier between Argentina and Brazil suspended last year will not be replayed, the Argentine Football Association (AFA) said on Tuesday. On Sept. 5, the game between the two soccer giants was cancelled after Brazilian health authoriti... [727 chars]

articles.title: ANALYSIS-As economy wilts, Argentina's Massa seeks to sow hope with farm chiefs
articles.description: "The main message he told them: 'Trust me,'" said the source. Massa, a savvy politician who on Aug. 3 became the country's third economy minister in little over a month, is widely seen as President Alberto Fernandez's last hope to halt upwards of 90% inflation this year and the rapidly declining value of the peso currency, which has led farmers to significantly slow their sales.
articles.content: The "superminister" tasked with rescuing Argentina's crisis-racked economy needs cash now, and so just days into the job he has launched a charm offensive to win over farm industry titans to access crucial debt forgiveness ahead of a looming deadline... [4168 chars]

articles.title: FACTBOX-Monkeypox cases and deaths around the world
articles.description:
* The UNITED ARAB EMIRATES had reported 16 infections as of July 24. AMERICAS * ARGENTINA had confirmed 49 cases as of Aug. 11. * The BAHAMAS confirmed its first case on June 24.
* BRAZIL had confirmed 2,893 cases by Aug. 14. * BOLIVIA had confirmed 15 cases by Aug. 15.
